definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: the deadline fall in the vacation or holiday , it can be put off in turn .
sentences.chinese: 不过期限的最后一日如果是节假日，可以顺延。

sentences.english: For the interest class date felt on a public holiday, the lesson will be proponed to a week later.
sentences.chinese: 凡课当日为公众假期，当日兴趣班顺延至下周举行。

sentences.english: The debit date will be on the next working day if the day fails on a non-working day.
sentences.chinese: 如扣账日为非工作日，则顺延至下一个工作天。

sentences.english: Promise in contract or other conditions which Party A agree to prolong completion date.
sentences.chinese: 合同中约定或甲方代表同意给予顺延的其他情况。

sentences.english: Putting off or delaying or deferring an action to a later time.
sentences.chinese: 将一项活动推迟或拖延或顺延到以后的。

sentences.english: Discounts should not be extended during peak occupancy periods.
sentences.chinese: 在平季，折扣不应该被顺延执行。

sentences.english: The dates mentioned above will be postponed to the next Monday due to the weekends.
sentences.chinese: 以上日期逢周末顺延至下周一。

sentences.english: The new regulations become effective for plans issuedafter July 1.
sentences.chinese: 新团体保健保险计划条例的实施要顺延到七月一日后。

sentences.english: Notices will be handed out during classes or by phone. Classes will be automatically postponed.
sentences.chinese: 本社将发通告，或以电话通知，堂數将自动顺延。

definition: to notify at a different time/to notify later/to give prior notice
to reschedule/to rearrange (e.g. a meeting)/to postpone
to have a power failure/power cut
to push back (progress, the times etc)
unpredictable eventuality/unpreventable/unavoidable/impossible to overcome/nothing can be done about it/act of God/force majeure
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
